meanings.sent1: The dream seemed to prefigure the events of the next day.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds prefigure a storm approaching.
meanings.sent3: Her habit of always carrying an umbrella prefigures her fear of unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder prefigures the arrival of a summer storm.
meanings.sent5: The old map prefigures the layout of the modern city.

meanings.sent1: The strange symbol on the door prefigures the mysterious events inside.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature prefigures the onset of winter.
meanings.sent3: His habit of checking the weather forecast every morning prefigures his obsession with being prepared.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest prefigures the appearance of a hidden danger.
meanings.sent5: The first few raindrops prefigure the coming downpour.

meanings.definition: To serve as a sign or warning of something to come
meanings.sent1: The red sky at night prefigures a beautiful sunrise in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The early signs of fatigue prefigure the need for a break.
meanings.sent3: The chirping of birds outside prefigures the start of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of sirens prefigures an approaching emergency.
meanings.sent5: The first blooms of spring prefigure the warmer days ahead.
